review: Overwatch Who?

《诗经·彼阳》
彼阳若至，初升东曦。
绯雾飒蔽，似幕绡绸。
彼阳篝碧，雾霂涧滁。
赤石冬溪，似玛瑙潭。
彼阳晚意，暖梦似乐。
寐游浮沐，若雉飞舞。
Собираю деньги на билет до офиса близад не равнодушные поддержите.
Am I the only give this game a blue thumb?
"бобби не смог смирится с поражением и куда это тебя привело, снова ко мне" - Габен.

As much as it is a really good game and most hatred is towards Blizzard I think there is also a few, like me, that dislike towards it because the things that they have changed from Overwatch 1 over to 2. One example being that they have removed loot boxes, which were easy to get in 1, and basically replaced it with a battle pass that makes people have to buy it for more cosmetics and to play the new hero each season early. I do however like the new season with hero progression, however they are still wanting us to pay with the new story missions even if everything else is free to play.


Overall I do think I play the game more now then whenever I played Overwatch 1 so I will have to give some kudos for that. I do miss the capture points though :[

This is the greatest advertisement for Team Fortress and other more direct hero shooters on the market. 

Overwatch 2 runs poorly, is monetized to hell and back; and worse still, is not fun to play. Somehow, Blizzard thought it was a good idea to make the game less fun than it's original incarnation and have the gall to make it so that it's a grindy mess to achieve even basic heroes. 

No thanks, I'm not gonna do that. Instead, I'd ask people to download Team Fortress: https://www.teamfortress.com/

D o g s h i t ® 2

[h1]Opinión de un jugador veterano[/h1]
"Juego increíble llevado por una compañía desastrosa."

A pesar de todo y dejando de lado las polémicas de Blizzard considero que, tras un año, el juego está en muy buen estado. Cada vez están actualizándolo más y metiendo más contenido. [i]Intentan[/i] escuchar a la comunidad, en especial con los cambios a personajes, han arreglado en parte muchos de los problemas que había en el inicio del juego, como la monetización (aunque aún podría mejorar) y sinceramente creo que el contenido que hay ahora está bastante completo. Es con el que debería haber salido Overwatch 2 en su salida.

Blizzard aún debe hacer un esfuerzo mayor si realmente quiere tener su arco de redención y contentar al público, en especial con la monetización y las promesas falsas. Pero también creo que la comunidad critica en exceso cosas que [b]muchas[/b] veces no lo merecen.

[h1] "You've been hoodwinked, baby!" [/h1]

[DO NOT BUY THE PVE DLC ON STEAM. IT WON'T REGISTER AS OWNED IN GAME]


Blizzard promised a bigger, bolder, and more balanced experience. They also were finally giving us a full PvE campaign, complete with skill trees, levels, unlockables, and more. After hundreds of hours, how does it hold up?

- The move to one tank was disastrous, resulting in half the tank lineup to be a guaranteed 
   loss if picked. 

- Balance is handled with the utmost care a sledgehammer can provide. 

- Campaign is entirely gutted, and is now going to be episodically released in 3 missions sets, 
  each running $15. Skill trees and progression are gone too.

- The decisions to lock new heroes behind either grinding BP tiers for so many games/levels 
  or a paywall (premium BP) essentially makes the game pay-to-win, including in competitive.

- On (Steam) launch, Blizzard couldn't QA their connection to the steam store, apparently, as 
   buying anything through steam won't actually grant you what you buy, including the 
   campaign.

- The elimination of the OW1 system of loot boxes in favor of ultimately underwhelming battle 
   passes or an [i] EGREGIOUSLY [/i] overpriced in-game store just sucks.



Overwatch 2 is a hollow shell of what Blizzard promised. I cannot recommend spending any money on this game at this time. If you're looking for a class based FPS, I recommend the definitive OW competitor on Steam, TF2. It even has custom loadouts and free PvE!

Overwatch has a bad history, but it is not a bad game. I would definitely give this game a try. It's free, it's fun, and I think that it deserves at least some consideration. 

I've played this game since it first came out. So have a lot of the people who are now negative review bombing it. A lot of scandals, poor decisions, and neglect made them bitter. It was hard not to be, after years of what seemed to be no progress. But after the reshuffle of the Blizzard teams and leadership, I think it's heading in a better direction. I'm really hopeful for the way its going. 

Don't let this resentful crowd deter you from trying it out. Chances are, they won't be playing with you, so there's no need to worry.

[h1]Balance[/h1]

Blizzard are the only company [strike]brave[/strike] [b]stupid[/b] enough to ignore balance suggestions from...
[list]
    [*]Professional players
    [*]Top 500 streamers
    [*]Long time Top 500 players
[/list]

All so that they can balance their FPS around the entire ranked Bronze->Platinum players with zero understanding of any of the basics of the game. Most of their balances have come from "data" that is pulled from the entirety of it's competitive system (and that does include all data from Bronze through to the highest levels of Grandmaster/Top 500).

They wanted their esports to be taken seriously yet they take none of the balance seriously by listening to the players that casually play it, and look what that's done.

Coming back after a few months of not playing on the grand launch of the Steam version, having the great opportunity to finally remove Battle.net's launcher, to trying to play this game (even casually, which since the beginning of OW2 has become a sweat fest) has shown that the devs very lacklustre approach to their balance. It feels no different. The tiny balance adjustments don't do anything. Especially when common heroes that people across all ranks (and especially high ranked) complain about are still frustratingly untouched and make the games they dominate feel just as unfun (Discord, Damage Amp, etc).

[h1]PvE[/h1]

They spent 3 years trying to make a PvE side of the game, withholding content for them to spit in our face, say "Soz lol PvE is gonna be slowly releasing instead... also that Watchpoint Pack we promised would give you access to PvE is reverted... buy another pass."

[h1]Conclusion...[/h1]

Blizzard's true crime is their sheer unwillingness to listen, and especially their ego in thinking they know whats best for their game themselves (despite most of them being horrendously low ranked in their own game). And outside of the PvP... The fact they've withheld development for 3 years before forcing out OW2 and only have from what I can see... a years worth of content to show in comparison to what other titles can pull of is actually disgusting. And PvE has only just been released and it's only coming out bit by bit... actually a joke.
F... You Blizzard ! TOOOOOOXXXIC

Perdi 8 anos nesta desgraça e pelo andar das contas vou perder mais ainda. Não sei o que mais me irrita: eu continuar a jogar quando todos sabemos que a vida deste jogo acabou em 2018/2019 ou a blizzard inteira,
Pelo lado positivo agora posso apagar a battle.net e  como as horas foram apagadas não mostra mais que tenho bem mais de mil horas nesta desgraça. 

Todos têm aquele jogo pvp com milhares de horas que ninguém nunca recomenda mas joga toda a season na mesma. Overwatch infelizmente é o meu, prazer. 5/10 perderia mais 8 anos a jogar (o Overwatch no caso o Overwatch 2 não existe porque nunca meteram aqui o que prometeram dele).
i cant tell which company is fumbling more, Blizzard or Bungie. Both of them are getting so desperate XD, gotta say this one might be a tad worse.

Playing this game makes you feel like you're a punching bag, it hasn't been in an enjoybale state since 2018. It is the only game I have played with well over 7k hours easily and I can say confidently that I have 0 faith the game will ever redeem itself, it is the biggest disappointment to ever exist. They made us wait 3 years without anything, just to scrap the promised pve before the game released and waited months into release while still teasing what they promised with pve to say they scrapped it. On top of that pvp has been in shambles for years it has a few bright moments that get derailed by horrible balance changes, they're slow to react with bugs, nerfs, and buffs. The game has been out for 9 months and all they've done is take away a tank and it has destroyed the feeling that this is a team based game, and have taken things away from overwatch and slowly add it back to give the illusion of new features, 9 months in and the same bugs keep reappearing for the same characters with no real fixes. Overpriced skins, the dev team is clueless on whether they want a casual shooter or top of the market comp scene, and they manipulated an entire fan base into thinking the 3 year drought was for something they completely knew before launch wasn't going to ever happen. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO ANYONE.

Les manipulations pour faire allonger les billets du style battlepasses et skins, d'accord. Valorant et entièrement construit pour faire payer les joueurs, et ça marche (et en plus, c'est des mecs random qui paient le jeu à ma place).
Les scandales de l'entreprise, tant que leurs jeux sont bien, c'est pas mon problème en tant que joueur.

Par contre, le coup du 2ème opus "pour le PvE" (et nouvelles mécaniques de microtransactions), et au final la campagne est annulée sans prévenir les joueurs, ça, non.
Pas question de laisser passer un truc pareil. Si les joueurs disent rien, l'industrie va continuer à nous l'enfoncer encore plus profond, et c'est pour ça que je laisse cette review.
